test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS continuously monitors temperature in all GMP storage areas as specified in URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Access the EMS software interface.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS software interface is accessible and displays current temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Verify temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature readings are recorded at intervals of 5 minutes or less.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are continuously monitored and recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to a known value.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature setpoint is successfully set.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for the temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.
prerequisites: System is installed and powered on
Test environment with controlled temperature conditions

test_steps.action: Set up the test environment to a known temperature within the specified range using a calibrated reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: Test environment stabilizes at the set temperature.

test_steps.action: Compare the system's temperature reading with the reference device reading.
test_steps.expected_result: System reading matches the reference device within ±0.5°C.
data_to_capture: Difference between system and reference readings

acceptance_criteria: System temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings for all tested temperatures.
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature readings must be stored in the vendor's standard database format without modification.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system correctly integrates with the site paging system to deliver alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.
prerequisites: Test temperature conditions can be simulated

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint in the test environment.
test_steps.expected_result: System detects the temperature deviation and triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Verify that the alarm notification is received by the site paging system within 30 seconds.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system receives and displays the alarm notification within the specified time.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are delivered to the paging system within 30 seconds of temperature deviation detection.
Notification content matches the expected format and includes all required information.
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be recorded in the system's audit trail with timestamps.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly integrates with the site paging system to send alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.
prerequisites: Site paging system is configured and operational

test_steps.action: Set the temperature probe to simulate a deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS detects the temperature deviation and triggers an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Monitor the site paging system for the alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received on the site paging system within 30 seconds of the alarm condition.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notification is received within 30 seconds of the temperature deviation
Notification contains accurate temperature deviation information
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm records must be complete and accurate
Notification records must match alarm records

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly archives and retains monitoring data for the required 7-year period using the vendor's archival feature.
prerequisites: Historical data exists in the system

test_steps.action: Access the vendor's archival interface and initiate a data retrieval request for data older than 1 year.
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully retrieves archived data meeting the search criteria.

test_steps.action: Verify the integrity of the retrieved data by comparing with known historical records.
test_steps.expected_result: Retrieved data matches known historical records without alteration.

acceptance_criteria: System successfully retrieves data older than 1 year
Retrieved data maintains complete integrity with no alterations
data_integrity_requirements: Archived data must be complete and unaltered
Data retrieval must be reliable and consistent

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 27.1°C using a test sensor.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 22.9°C using a test sensor.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both upper and lower threshold breaches
Alerts are generated within 30 seconds of deviation
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must be time-stamped and immutable
Alert records must be stored in the vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system properly retains and archives data for the required 7-year period.
prerequisites: System has been operational for at least 1 month

test_steps.action: Generate test data records spanning different dates over the past month.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and stores all test data records.

test_steps.action: Initiate the archival process using the vendor's built-in functionality.
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully archives data without corruption.

test_steps.action: Verify archived data can be retrieved and is complete.
test_steps.expected_result: All test records are retrievable and intact.

acceptance_criteria: All data is successfully archived without loss
Archived data maintains original timestamps and values
Data can be retrieved after archival
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 for electronic records retention
EU GMP Annex 11 for data integrity
data_integrity_requirements: Data must remain readable throughout retention period

test_cases.objective: Verify the EMS successfully interfaces with the existing facility management system using standard protocols.
prerequisites: Facility management system is available and configured for integration

test_steps.action: Configure the EMS to communicate with the facility management system using the specified protocol.
test_steps.expected_result: Connection between EMS and facility management system is established successfully.

test_steps.action: Send a test data packet from the EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is received and processed correctly by the facility management system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS and facility management system communicate without errors.
Data is accurately transmitted and received.
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be transmitted without corruption or loss.

test_cases.test_name: Alarm Notification Integration with Paging System
test_cases.objective: Ensure the EMS alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.
prerequisites: Site paging system is available and configured for integration

test_steps.action: Configure the EMS to send alarm notifications to the site paging system via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: API connection is established successfully.

test_steps.action: Trigger a test alarm in the EMS and verify the notification is received by the paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is correctly received and displayed by the paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are successfully sent to the paging system.
Notifications are received within the expected time frame.
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm notifications must be transmitted without delay or loss.
